events.message: Customer reported an accident involving their sedan hitting a utility pole causing front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to a vehicle collision and property damage.
An experienced agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim promptly.
The customer received official acknowledgment of the claim submission with next steps outlined.
Customer was asked to provide photos of the damaged vehicle and police accident report for review.
All requested documents including photos and police reports were submitted by the customer on time.
Investigation into the collision circumstances began involving reviewing submitted evidence and statements.
Investigation concluded confirming that the other driver was at fault for the collision incident.
A full settlement proposal was sent to the customer covering vehicle repair costs and rental reimbursement.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and promptness of claim handling process.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager following a favorable settlement agreement.
Payment for vehicle repairs and related expenses was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account successfully.
The claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation that repairs were completed.
All claim documentation was archived for future reference and record keeping as per company policy.
